Articles.Content:
Hi

Love this one. Thanks for the update.

Vive\_moi

Alright, I was ready to launch my first telescope rocket, but once I switch from VAB to launch platform, the camera stats to shake, and the whole rockets except the telescope start to rise with in the background engine RCS noise.. The same happens if I remove all parts except for the Telescope. Is anyone else experiencing this problem?

EDit: putting the ModuleTrackBodies partmodule one any other part result in the same effect. This modulePart is defiantly creating the effect in KSP 1.1.2

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-08T10:58:39Z" title="05/08/2016 10:58  AM" data-short="8 yr">May 8, 2016</time> by FreeThinker**
Is this due to be updated on CKAN? Probably just me being impatient for it...

BUG: The difficulty buttons in the UI selector have no effect. I just edited the values I wanted into the config file in my save directory, but clicking the Easy, Normal, etc buttons on the UI didn't change the ignored planets.

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> Alright, I was ready to launch my first telescope rocket, but once I switch from VAB to launch platform, the camera stats to shake, and the whole rockets except the telescope start to rise with in the background engine RCS noise.. The same happens if I remove all parts except for the Telescope. Is anyone else experiencing this problem?
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> EDit: putting the ModuleTrackBodies partmodule one any other part result in the same effect. This modulePart is defiantly creating the effect in KSP 1.1.2
> 

I had the same problem. Actually, the problem is that the telescope is the first part of the rocket. My problem was resolved when I put an probe core as the first part of the rocket, and after that I attached the telescope on it.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Bikini said:
> 
> 
> I had the same problem. Actually, the problem is that the telescope is the first part of the rocket. My problem was resolved when I put an probe core as the first part of the rocket, and after that I attached the telescope on it.
> 

Thanks. this should be in the first page as a known issue.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-08T17:03:54Z" title="05/08/2016 05:03  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 8, 2016</time> by FreeThinker**

Alright, after some hacks, I finally for to cataloging the planets. So I simply aim at a body and observe and let Werner research for money untill discover. So basically it is a money to science converter. It does seem that challenging after you discovered the first body. just repeat. Only  the last unknown object (after jool) doesn't want to be found. Perhaps it is too far away.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-09T22:38:40Z" title="05/09/2016 10:38  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 9, 2016</time> by FreeThinker**

> 
> 
> On 5/8/2016 at 9:54 AM, Bikini said:
> 
> 
> I had the same problem. Actually, the problem is that the telescope is the first part of the rocket. My problem was resolved when I put an probe core as the first part of the rocket, and after that I attached the telescope on it.
> 

Still having this issue even with it not as the first part. Removed all mods and still same issue with the camera getting stuck suddenly and the rocket flies away. Changed root parts, even mounted them sideways and upside down, with or without fairings. KSP's debug doesn't say anything and nor does the flight log.

I've had it consistently do this when the altitude hits about 6000m. Stops happening as soon as I pull the telescope off.

Not that it matters, also checked in both 32-bit and 64-bit, same issue. Will upload the output\_log in a bit.

Found the nullref in the log, it's in the spoiler there, I just replaced my username in Windows with username. Copy/pasted the nullref here too.

NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object  

  at RenderingManager.AddToPostDrawQueue (Int32 queueSpot, .Callback drawFunction) [0x00000] in <filename unknown="">:0
</filename>

  at ResearchBodies.ModuleTrackBodies.OnStart (StartState state) [0x00000] in <filename unknown="">:0
</filename>

  at Part.ModulesOnStart () [0x00000] in <filename unknown="">:0
</filename>

  at Part+.MoveNext () [0x00000] in <filename unknown="">:0
</filename>

I'll also do a full reinstall and see if that helps. This was a previously modded install copy/pasted into a fresh folder for testing individual mods.

Edit: Apologies, log deleted.

> Uh, it's in the spoiler in my previous post. Also, full reinstall with a fresh download from Steam yielded the same results, camera loss at 6000m.

Sorry forum broke because of your gigantic post with a log and it lost my reply.  

Please don't post log files into the forum. Use dropbox, etc.  

What I did say was: RenderingManager  is deprecated in KSP 1.1+ and cannot be used.  

I'm surprised it is working for anyone. It uses this for the PART menu when in flight.  

I'm talking to simon56modder about a fix. So stay tuned!

> 
> 
> 5 minutes ago, JPLRepo said:
> 
> 
> Sorry forum broke because of your gigantic post with a log and it lost my reply.

> 
> I'm surprised it is working for anyone. It uses this for the PART menu when in flight.  
> 
> I'm talking to simon56modder about a fix. So stay tuned!
> 

Sorry! Didn't know, I edited the post to remove the log, will use a fileshare in the future. Thanks for the quick look though, much appreciated!

I have been in discussions with simon56modder who does not have the time to look after his mod any more, announcement soon. In the meantime I will get a Dev patch up sometime today.

Thanks for working on this, JPL. I actually just uninstalled the mod a few days ago because I was too ~~lazy~~ busy to troubleshoot, but I can confirm.  

Good luck finding a fix, but don't work too hard ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

[@Venusgate](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/125730-venusgate/) [@IggyHitokage](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/145193-iggyhitokage/) [@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/) [@Bikini](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/163837-bikini/) and everyone else who uses this mod:

V1.7.1 Available on GitHub only at this stage on the link below, source code is also there as well. License is still the same as the OP. Should fix the issues with the telescope. **PLEASE ENSURE YOU COMPLETELY DELETE PREVIOUS** versions from Gamedata\ResearchBodies before installing as I have moved files around to more standard locations. I have also Added KSP-AVC version checking to the install. The required speach with regard to that (forum rules):  

This mod includes version checking using [MiniAVC](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/72169-104-ksp-avc-add-on-version-checker-plugin-115-amp-miniavc-amp-ksp-avc-online/&do=findComment&comment=1142261).  

If you opt-in, it will use the internet to check whether there is a new version available.  

Data is only read from the internet and no personal information is sent.  

For a more comprehensive version checking experience, please download the [KSP-AVC Plugin](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/72169-104-ksp-avc-add-on-version-checker-plugin-115-amp-miniavc-amp-ksp-avc-online/&do=findComment&comment=1142261)  

More information and announcement coming soon.

[https://github.com/JPLRepo/ResearchBodies/releases/tag/V1.7.1](https://github.com/JPLRepo/ResearchBodies/releases/tag/V1.7.1)

Much thanks! Finally, I can expand beyond Mun. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

<u>Important information</u>

**USER JPLRepo IS TAKING THE DEVELOPMENT OF THIS MOD. while he is doing so, download will still be available until he publishes a new version of the mod.**

***Thanks a lot for taking the dev of Research Bodies* ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")**

Thanks simon56modder for this great mod. **Round of applause for simon56modder please!**  

I hope to keep it going and add more new exciting features soon.  
  
**[I have created a new Forum Thread here with new download links](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/139473-112)**. Please take all discussions to that thread.
